results.title: Standing waves and the principle of superposition
results.creator_credit: Ron Sorri and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates what happens when waves meet and how a standing wave is formed by the superposition of identical travelling waves in opposite directions.

results.title: Standing Up for Joe (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A film about conductive therapy in Hungary. A little used but successful program for cerebral palsy. Shows parents of young children going to Hungary and becoming involved in a successful program leading to some level of independence for the child.
results.description: A film about conductive therapy in Hungary. A little used but successful program for cerebral palsy. Shows parents of young children going to Hungary and becoming involved in a successful program leading to some level of independence for the child.

results.title: Standing room only
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, Sidney Meyers and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the implications of the world’s burgeoning population growth depicting ideas for distributing food surpluses, exploiting the oceans, increasing agricultural activity. Examines several of the procedures including birth control whereby this growth can be controlled. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Standing in the shadows of Motown [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Rimshot Productions, Sandy Passman and Paul Justman
results.brief_description: This award winning, acclaimed documentary is in part a biographical profile of the Funk Brothers, the Hitsville studio band originally assembled by Berry Gordy in 1959, who played behind numerous Motown Records hits, but whose talents went largely unsung. In this work remaining band members are reunited to reminisce about past glories and those departed, and in order to stage a concert that celebrates their contribution to music. Using archival footage, this work also addresses the cultural revolution of the rhythm and blues movement of the 1950s and the racism and inequities that saw the originators of the music, principally African Americans, languish whilst their white counterparts (such as Elvis Presley) prospered. In Detroit the Funk brothers overcame these hurdles with a new sound - known as Motown - that not only championed their artistry but also were phenomenally successful, producing hit after hit. Musicians featured in the reunion concert include: Joan Osborne, Ben Harper, Me’Shell Ndege Ocello, Chaka Khan, Bootsy Collins and the Funk Brothers.

results.title: Standing Alone
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Colin Low
results.brief_description: Pete Standing Alone is a Blood Indian who, as a young man, was more at home in the White man’s culture than his own. However, confronted with the realisation that his children knew very little about their origins, he became determined to pass down to them the customs and traditions of his ancestors. This hour-long film is the powerful biographical study of a twenty-five-year span in Pete’s life, from his early days as an oil-rig roughneck, rodeo rider and cowboy, to the present as an Indian concerned with preserving his tribe’s spiritual heritage in the face of an energy-oriented industrial age. Includes footage of a traditional headdress and saddle being presented to Prince Charles. Photographed by Douglas Kiefer and Ernest McNabb. Edited by Tom Daly. Music by Eldon Rathburn. Sound by Bev Davidson, Claude Hazanavicius and John Knight (Awards: San Antonio, Vancouver)

results.title: Standards at work; Living with standards
results.brief_description: Describes what Australian Standards are and how they affect everyone’s lives. Standards at work shows their use in improving product quality and Australias’ competitive edge and introduces the Supplier Assessment and Standards Mark Schemes. Living with standards shows how they are written, where they are applied, the principles of standardization and how they promote better quality in products and services.

results.title: Stand by me (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, ACT III Communications, Andrew Scheinman, Bruce A. Evans, Raynold Gideon and Rob Reiner
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1956, four youths set out on a two-day trek through the woods surrounding their home-town of Castle Rock, Oregon, to find the undiscovered body of a dead teenager reported missing for several days. Their adventure is filled with humour and suspense as they learn about friendship and growing up. Starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland, John Cusack and Richard Dreyfuss.

results.title: Stand and deliver
results.creator_credit: Tom Musca, Warner Bros Pictures and Ramon Menendez
results.brief_description: Edward James Olmos gives a widely-acclaimed performance as Jaime Escalante, a dedicated Maths teacher at a Los Angeles high school where most of the inner-city students are underachievers and come from poor Latin American families. Escalante refuses to see them as losers and cajoles, pushes and inspires his class to become Maths wizards and to pass a national exam which no student of the school has ever passed before. With Lou Diamond Phillips and Andy Garcia.
